name: 001 - Pre Works
Site Inspection / Establishment & Isolation
Confirm address and delivery location
Make contact with Builder project Team and establish work hours etc
Create SWMs and issue to site team along with insurances
Confirm Premier site team and all tools have been organised ( Site box, ladders etc)
Once onsite review all documents and have a site walk to create any dilapidation report required for existing state of the site
Once dilapidation report has been completed begin make safe of existing Power, Lighting and Data as required
Issue the isolation Cert in next tab along with all documentation required to Builder team following make safe
Temp Power & Lighting
Discuss with Builder team for locations of proposed Temp DB and lighting across the site
Install Temp DB and Lighting to site as planned
Issue Builder team CCEW once temps have been installed with all information regarding the temp install for Breaker cascade
Assure all temp leads and DBs have been tested, Tagged and are in date.
Issue test and tag register to the builder
Conduits / Trenching & Underground Installation
Review all documents to assure that all runs have been accounted for
Conduit/ fitting size, type and locations correct
Conduit bends and radius satisfactory and ends sealed
Anchoring of conduit, accessories and all joints secure
Conduit labelled/ identified as latest AFC Drawing
Unfinished conduits labelled and ends taped in readiness for continuance in next section
Clearances to formwork and parallel steel sufficient
Draw wire installed
Expansion joints fitted correctly
Concrete pour witnessed
Conduits inspected afterwards to assure they are free from defects
Update As-builts if required to show any changes to conduit runs
010 - In-Slab Works Installation
Coordination
Ensure that all new installations have been coordinated with other services, both new and existing
Metering / Setting Out
Ensure that the latest service drawings are being referenced
Ensure that the latest coordinated drawings are being referenced
Ensure correct datum points are identified confirm datum points with building works supervisor. Use correct set out measurement tools and equipment
Engage certified surveyor for critical set out works
Conduit Selection
Identify circuit to be installed, confirm circuit cabling requirement. Select conduit size accordingly
Conduit Installation (General)
Conduit to be measured and cut using correct tools
All conduit bends to be sweeping using bending spring. Or large sweeping proprietary bends
All joins to be glued using PVC jointing cement
All conduit boxes to be correct type with correct number of entry points i.e. 2way, 3 way T, 4way
Do not use corrugated conduit in decks
Conduit Installation (Fixing)
Ensure entire conduit installation is fixed to steel work using tie wire
Conduit should be tied to bottom mat of steel
Ensure conduit installation is supported from deck over entire length
Where deck is post tension and steel support is minimal, use deck chairs and spare steel
Cast In Items

Ensure that the void/materials are fixed securely at its final location with the correct dimensions to allow the final equipment to be installed at FFL and Adjacent to walls, floor Boxes & Cast in Light's etc
Conduit Installation (Covering)
Ensure sufficient concrete cover can be achieved
Earthing
Ensure that if the slab may be used as a floor for showers and bathrooms have an equipotential bond to the steel reinforcement.
Concrete Pour
Observe concrete pour with particular attention to critical area
018 - Backbone Copper Cabling
Cable Installation
Ensure that the latest drawings are being referenced
Ensure the cable has adequate support and does need exceed manufactures bending radius and is segregated to other services as per AS S2009:2013
Installation of Distribution Boards
Ensure the distribution frame is fastened securely and at appropriate height for future maintenance and expansion
Termination
Ensure that all cores are punched down with the manufactures punch down tool and in the correct colour Sequence
Testing
Test each pair on the disconnect module for correct wire mapping
Final Inspection
Cross check and verify that the As Built Drawings are Complete and Correct
Verify all inspections are complete and collate records
005 - Power
Rough In
All fit off Accessories have been signed off for approval by the engineer, architect or consultant
Review drawings and create a list of any RFI's regarding the mounting or install of the Power fit off accessories that are not detailed in the drawings.
All Power circuits are adequately loaded and create a line diagram if required for the circuits.
Wire each zone per the plans. Assure each loom is tied back adequately with hits or on tray to the DB.
Update any changes of "P" numbers as you are roughing in.
Assure that plans have been completely highlighted as the circuits have been roughed in. Provide a photo of this to the Builder on completion
Power Drops have been dropped into place. Notify locations of the walls that can be closed. Assure that fit off sections for Lighting and Comms have also been completed.
Fit Off
Have a fresh copy of the plans to highlight as connections are terminated
Assure all terminals, connectors are securely tightened

After all GPO's within ceilings have been terminated. Notify the builder for locations of the ceiling that can be closed. Assure that all fit off of Lighting and Comms within the ceiling has also been completed.
Circuits have been run back to the indicated DB. Circuits have been tightly screwed into RCBO's and cabling neatly installed inside of the panel. Neutrals and earths are install per CB number.
GPO's and other fit off accessories have been installed to locations shown on the latest construction set of plans
Testing
Installation complies with drawings
Complete the attached Power test results for all Power circuits and Sub Main supplies
All Power circuits have been labelled per "DB number - CB number" and affixed to a visible location
Update any changes to drawings and issue as "As-Built".
007 - Communication
Rough In
Assure that you have all the relevant drawings onsite and printed to scale
Review all Communication Tech data sheets to assure that cable, jacks etc are being installed per specified
All Communications material has been signed off for approval by the engineer, architect or consultant
Review drawings and create a list of any RFI's regarding the mounting or install of the lights that are not detailed in the drawings.
Mark up Communication plans with the appropriate and approved labelling methodology.
Check that cabling is going to be within the allowed 90m tolerance for the longer runs shown on your drawing.
Update any changes of wire numbers as you are roughing in.
Assure that plans have been completely highlighted as the cables have been roughed in. Provide a photo of this to the Builder on completion
Data drops have been dropped into place. Notify locations of the walls that can be closed. Assure that fit off sections for power and Lighting have also been completed.
Fit Off
Have a fresh copy of the plans to highlight as Jacks are terminated
Assure all Jacks, connectors are securely terminated and installed into the corresponding plate or patch panel. Cable to be labelled within 300mm of termination.

After all jacks within ceilings have been terminated. Notify the builder for locations of the ceiling that can be closed. Assure that all fit off of Power and Lighting within the ceiling has also been completed.
Looms that have been run back to the indicated Comms room or Rack. Looms are in no more the 24 cables and have been velcroed every 2-3m. Assure that looms are not fastened via cable ties or Tape.
Cable, jacks and patch panels have been installed to manufacturer's specification
Data outlets have been installed to locations shown on the latest construction set of plans
Testing
Installation complies with drawings
Complete the attached Communications test results for all Comms cables.
All data outlets have been affixed with a label on the plate and patch panel that relates to drawings.
Issue data results to the applicable manufacturer for the applicable warranty certificate.
014 - Cable Tray / Ladder
Support system suitability sized for expected load
Expected Load
Seismic Restrained
Support Bracket is Suitable
Coordination & clearance from other services has been complete
Approx Meterage
Cable support system require equipotential bonding
013 - Testing and Commissioning
Project Risk identification and management register.
Identify / acknowledge and manage risks involved with this task.
Correct test equipment to complete the task
The test equipment / multimeters etc must display current calibration information
Ensure the electrician who is to perform the works has been trained on correct operation of test equipment - multimeters
Ensure the electrician who is performing the works is familiar with the installation - If required walk them through the proposed work zone
Ensure the electrician performing the works has the latest redline marks up available and can easily identify circuit arrangements
Visual Inspection
Earth Continuity Resistance
Insulation Resistance
Polarity
Correct Circuit Connections
Earth Fault Loop Impedance
Upon completion of 'dead' testing present all documentation to Site supervisor for approval
Submit test results for review with site management
Test For Voltage
Phase rotation
Earth Fault Loop Impedance
Operation of Residual Current Devices
At works completion confirm all circuit schedules are complete & correct.
All circuit descriptions are clear & worded to be easily understood.
Any circuits not tested remain disconnected from circuit breaker & terminated in BP connected.
All equipment has been labelled in accordance with project requirements, and labelling aligns with as built drawings.
012 - Fit Off Power, Switches and Accessories
Template Name: 012 - Fit Off Power, Switches and Accessories

name: Ensure the fitting is compliant with Australian standards
Install GPOs / Switches as per manufacturers recommendations
Ensure GPOS are installed using the correct fixings and brackets
Ensure the correct item is being installed at each location prior to fit off (Current rating and Phases required)
Use fire boxes, acoustic boxes etc. where required - if in doubt check with the site manager
Ensure correct weatherproof fittings are used where required
All switches and GPOs are installed in a tradesman like manner, e.g. level.
Ensure that all penetrations through the steel structure have been properly washed before fitting off item
Bushing installed is not able to fall off over time
Penetration is sealed to prevent ingress of vermin before fit off where required.
Visually inspect entire circuit for completeness.
Ensure fittings are protected if required

011 - Mains & Sub Mains Installation
Cable Installation
Please attach marked up drawing - Please take photo of title block
All submains dressed in the formation specified on Fredon sub main installation check sheet.
Mechanical protection installed where required.
No cables to be tied to or supported by sprinkler / water pipes.
All submains have been kept clear of sharp edges during installation to avoid damage to insulation.
Visual Inspection of Rough In
Visual inspection of rough in carried out to ensure completion
All relevant drawings checked to ensure that all services have been allowed for

Cross check and verify that the as built drawings are complete and correct
Verify all inspections are complete and collate records
004 - Lighting
Rough In
Assure that you have all the relevant drawings onsite and printed to scale
Review all lighting Tech data sheets to assure that lights are being wired to control type (240v, dali, relay ETC)
All lights and control gear has been signed off for approval by the engineer, architect or consultant
Review drawings and create a list of any RFI's regarding the switching, mounting or install of the lights that are not detailed in the drawings.
All lighting circuits are adequately loaded and create any line diagrams if required for the zoning.
Wire each zone per the plans. Assure each loom is tied back adequately with hits or on tray to the DB
Update any changes of "L" numbers as you are roughing in.
Assure that plans have been completely highlighted as the circuits have been all roughed in. Provide a photo of this to the Builder on completion
Switch drops have been dropped into place. Notify locations of the walls that can be closed. Assure that fit off sections for Power and Comms have also been completed.
Fit Off
Have a fresh copy of the plans to highlight as connections are terminated
Assure all terminals, connectors are securely tightened

After all plug bases within ceilings have been terminated. Notify the builder for locations of the ceiling that can be closed. Assure that all fit off of Power and Data within the ceiling has also been completed.

Circuits have been run back to the indicated DB or lighting control panel. Circuits have been tightly screwed into RCBO's and cabling neatly installed inside of the panel. Neutrals and earths are install per CB number.
All light fittings have been checked to be defect free before install.
Lights have been installed to manufacturer's specifications
Lights have been installed to locations shown on the latest construction set of plans
Testing
Installation complies with drawings
Complete the attached Power test results for all lighting circuits
All Lights and control gear is fully functional and set to client requirements

006 - Switchboard
Rough In & Fit Off
Switchboard has been signed off for approval by the engineer, architect or consultant
Cable tray and brackets have been installed to allow the install of the New DB.
All Power & Lighting circuit looms are tied back adequately on tray to within the DB.
If Breakers have not be Preloaded, assure that the breakers are installed and are loaded to suit the circuit requirements.
Update any changes of "P" & "L" numbers as you are installing into CB's. Have a template of the DB schedule to update onto as you install.
Assure all terminals, connectors are securely tightened
Installation complies with drawings & standards.
Complete the below testing
Testing
Attach any relevant documents and photos

Test and record phase - phase voltages B-W (L3-L2)

Test and record phase - neutral voltages W-N (L2-N)
Test and record phase - neutral voltages B-N (L3-N)

017 - Fibre Optic Cable
Cable Installation
Ensure that the latest services and coordinated drawings are being referenced
Ensure the cable does need exceed manufactures bending radius and is segregated to other services as per AS S2009:2013
Ensure the cable pulling strength is not exceeded as per manufacturer's recommendations
Ensure the cable been loomed in neatly along cable pathway and has adequate service loop's at both origin and destination
Termination
Ensure the area for splicing has the appropriate workstation and is in a dust free environment
Cut the last 2 meters of the fibre and remove it to avoid any dirt, or damage from the hauling that may have taken place.
Ensure the cable is stripped using the specialised tools and remove all Gel using telstra wipes if applicable and secure kevlar rope
Ensure all equipment (cleaver and splicer) has been visually inspected, self checked, cleaned and regular servicing has been maintained
Ensure all splicing follows the correct sequence and any cut off shards are accounted for and disposed of correctly
Ensure fobot is securely placed inside enclosure and dust caps installed
Testing
Ensure that OTDR Testing is taken from both directions and at multiple wavelengths and all results are recorded with their core/cable no as per label on cabinet and latest revision drawings

Ensure that Light Source Testing has the correct parameters as per manufacturer and client requirements all results are recorded with their core/cable no as per label on cabinet and latest revision drawings
Test Results Recording
Ensure all test results are downloaded and stored in both their native format and as PDF's or safe keeping
Final Inspection
Cross check and verify that the as built drawings are complete and correct
Verify all testing are complete and collate records
01 5 - Horizontal Cabling
Horizontal Cabling Rough-in
Ensure that the latest services and coordinated drawings are being referenced
Ensure that the latest coordinated drawings are being referenced
Ensure the cable does need exceed manufactures bending radius and is segregated to other services as per AS S2009:2013
Ensure the cable has adequate support and the pathway is less than 90 m including service loops & goose necks before drops
Visual Inspection of Rough In
Visual inspection of rough in carried out to ensure completion.
Cabinet
Ensure Cabinet Layouts are installed to the latest drawing layouts with door swing and clearances considered
Ensure cabinet is secured and and all accessories, panels and management installed correctly to latest RU Layout Drawings
Ensure all shielded equipment is earthed and the electrical contractor has supplied an earth with a maximum resistance of 0.5Ω
Horizontal Cabling Fit-off
Ensure that cables are bunched into their final looms and dressed throughout the communications room to individual patch panels
Ensure that all cabling is terminated according to communications rack lay out drawings
Ensure that all cabling is terminated has been labelled
Final Inspection
Cross check and verify that the as built drawings are complete and correct
Verify all inspections are complete and collate records
Verify all testing are complete and collate records
